department.dept_long_name: Division of Engineering and Applied Sciences

course.title: Physical Mathematics I
course.faculty_text: Mauricio Santillana and Avi M. Shapiro
course.description: Introduction to methods for developing accurate approximate solutions for problems in the sciences that cannot be solved exactly, and integration with numerical methods and solutions. Topics include: approximate solution of integrals, algebraic equations, nonlinear ordinary differential equations and their stochastic counterparts, and partial differential equations. Introduction to "sophisticated" uses of MATLAB.
course.prerequisites: Applied Mathematics 104 (formerly Applied Mathematics 105a), Applied Mathematics 105 (formerly Applied Mathematics 105b) or equivalent.
